line_text: Now is the winter of our discontent
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Made glorious summer by this sun of York;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And all the clouds that lour'd upon our house
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: In the deep bosom of the ocean buried.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Now are our brows bound with victorious wreaths;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Our bruised arms hung up for monuments;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Our stern alarums changed to merry meetings,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Our dreadful marches to delightful measures.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Grim-visaged war hath smooth'd his wrinkled front;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And now, instead of mounting barded steeds
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To fright the souls of fearful adversaries,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: He capers nimbly in a lady's chamber
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To the lascivious pleasing of a lute.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: But I, that am not shaped for sportive tricks,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Nor made to court an amorous looking-glass;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I, that am rudely stamp'd, and want love's majesty
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To strut before a wanton ambling nymph;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I, that am curtail'd of this fair proportion,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Cheated of feature by dissembling nature,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Deformed, unfinish'd, sent before my time
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Into this breathing world, scarce half made up,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And that so lamely and unfashionable
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That dogs bark at me as I halt by them;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Why, I, in this weak piping time of peace,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Have no delight to pass away the time,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Unless to spy my shadow in the sun
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And descant on mine own deformity:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And therefore, since I cannot prove a lover,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To entertain these fair well-spoken days,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I am determined to prove a villain
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And hate the idle pleasures of these days.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Plots have I laid, inductions dangerous,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: By drunken prophecies, libels and dreams,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To set my brother Clarence and the king
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: In deadly hate the one against the other:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And if King Edward be as true and just
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: As I am subtle, false and treacherous,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: This day should Clarence closely be mew'd up,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: About a prophecy, which says that 'G'
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Of Edward's heirs the murderer shall be.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Dive, thoughts, down to my soul: here
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Clarence comes.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Brother, good day; what means this armed guard
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That waits upon your grace?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: His majesty
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Tendering my person's safety, hath appointed
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: This conduct to convey me to the Tower.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Upon what cause?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Because my name is George.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Alack, my lord, that fault is none of yours;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: He should, for that, commit your godfathers:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: O, belike his majesty hath some intent
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That you shall be new-christen'd in the Tower.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: But what's the matter, Clarence?  may I know?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Yea, Richard, when I know; for I protest
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: As yet I do not: but, as I can learn,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: He hearkens after prophecies and dreams;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And from the cross-row plucks the letter G.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And says a wizard told him that by G
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: His issue disinherited should be;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And, for my name of George begins with G,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: It follows in his thought that I am he.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: These, as I learn, and such like toys as these
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Have moved his highness to commit me now.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Why, this it is, when men are ruled by women:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: 'Tis not the king that sends you to the Tower:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: My Lady Grey his wife, Clarence, 'tis she
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That tempers him to this extremity.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Was it not she and that good man of worship,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Anthony Woodville, her brother there,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That made him send Lord Hastings to the Tower,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: From whence this present day he is deliver'd?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: We are not safe, Clarence; we are not safe.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: By heaven, I think there's no man is secure
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: But the queen's kindred and night-walking heralds
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That trudge betwixt the king and Mistress Shore.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Heard ye not what an humble suppliant
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Lord hastings was to her for his delivery?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Humbly complaining to her deity
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Got my lord chamberlain his liberty.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I'll tell you what; I think it is our way,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: If we will keep in favour with the king,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To be her men and wear her livery:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The jealous o'erworn widow and herself,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Since that our brother dubb'd them gentlewomen.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Are mighty gossips in this monarchy.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I beseech your graces both to pardon me;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: His majesty hath straitly given in charge
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That no man shall have private conference,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Of what degree soever, with his brother.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Even so; an't please your worship, Brakenbury,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: You may partake of any thing we say:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: We speak no treason, man: we say the king
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Is wise and virtuous, and his noble queen
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Well struck in years, fair, and not jealous;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: We say that Shore's wife hath a pretty foot,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A cherry lip, a bonny eye, a passing pleasing tongue;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And that the queen's kindred are made gentle-folks:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: How say you sir? Can you deny all this?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: With this, my lord, myself have nought to do.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Naught to do with mistress Shore! I tell thee, fellow,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: He that doth naught with her, excepting one,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Were best he do it secretly, alone.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What one, my lord?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Her husband, knave: wouldst thou betray me?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I beseech your grace to pardon me, and withal
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Forbear your conference with the noble duke.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: We know thy charge, Brakenbury, and will obey.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: We are the queen's abjects, and must obey.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Brother, farewell: I will unto the king;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And whatsoever you will employ me in,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Were it to call King Edward's widow sister,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I will perform it to enfranchise you.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Meantime, this deep disgrace in brotherhood
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Touches me deeper than you can imagine.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I know it pleaseth neither of us well.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Well, your imprisonment shall not be long;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Meantime, have patience.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I must perforce. Farewell.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Go, tread the path that thou shalt ne'er return.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Simple, plain Clarence! I do love thee so,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That I will shortly send thy soul to heaven,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: If heaven will take the present at our hands.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: But who comes here? the new-deliver'd Hastings?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Good time of day unto my gracious lord!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: As much unto my good lord chamberlain!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Well are you welcome to the open air.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: How hath your lordship brook'd imprisonment?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: With patience, noble lord, as prisoners must:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: But I shall live, my lord, to give them thanks
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That were the cause of my imprisonment.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: No doubt, no doubt; and so shall Clarence too;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: For they that were your enemies are his,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And have prevail'd as much on him as you.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: More pity that the eagle should be mew'd,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: While kites and buzzards prey at liberty.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What news abroad?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: No news so bad abroad as this at home;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The King is sickly, weak and melancholy,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And his physicians fear him mightily.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Now, by Saint Paul, this news is bad indeed.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: O, he hath kept an evil diet long,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And overmuch consumed his royal person:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: 'Tis very grievous to be thought upon.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What, is he in his bed?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: He is.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Go you before, and I will follow you.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: He cannot live, I hope; and must not die
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Till George be pack'd with post-horse up to heaven.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I'll in, to urge his hatred more to Clarence,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: With lies well steel'd with weighty arguments;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And, if I fall not in my deep intent,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Clarence hath not another day to live:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Which done, God take King Edward to his mercy,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And leave the world for me to bustle in!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: For then I'll marry Warwick's youngest daughter.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What though I kill'd her husband and her father?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The readiest way to make the wench amends
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Is to become her husband and her father:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The which will I; not all so much for love
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: As for another secret close intent,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: By marrying her which I must reach unto.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: But yet I run before my horse to market:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Clarence still breathes; Edward still lives and reigns:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: When they are gone, then must I count my gains.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Set down, set down your honourable load,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: If honour may be shrouded in a hearse,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Whilst I awhile obsequiously lament
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: The untimely fall of virtuous Lancaster.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Poor key-cold figure of a holy king!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Pale ashes of the house of Lancaster!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Thou bloodless remnant of that royal blood!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Be it lawful that I invocate thy ghost,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: To hear the lamentations of Poor Anne,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Wife to thy Edward, to thy slaughter'd son,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Stabb'd by the selfsame hand that made these wounds!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Lo, in these windows that let forth thy life,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: I pour the helpless balm of my poor eyes.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Cursed be the hand that made these fatal holes!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Cursed be the heart that had the heart to do it!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Cursed the blood that let this blood from hence!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: More direful hap betide that hated wretch,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: That makes us wretched by the death of thee,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Than I can wish to adders, spiders, toads,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Or any creeping venom'd thing that lives!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: If ever he have child, abortive be it,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Prodigious, and untimely brought to light,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Whose ugly and unnatural aspect
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: May fright the hopeful mother at the view;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: And that be heir to his unhappiness!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: If ever he have wife, let her he made
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: A miserable by the death of him
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: As I am made by my poor lord and thee!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Come, now towards Chertsey with your holy load,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Taken from Paul's to be interred there;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: And still, as you are weary of the weight,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Rest you, whiles I lament King Henry's corse.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Stay, you that bear the corse, and set it down.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: What black magician conjures up this fiend,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: To stop devoted charitable deeds?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Villains, set down the corse; or, by Saint Paul,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: I'll make a corse of him that disobeys.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: My lord, stand back, and let the coffin pass.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Unmanner'd dog! stand thou, when I command:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Advance thy halbert higher than my breast,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Or, by Saint Paul, I'll strike thee to my foot,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: And spurn upon thee, beggar, for thy boldness.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: What, do you tremble? are you all afraid?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Alas, I blame you not; for you are mortal,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: And mortal eyes cannot endure the devil.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Avaunt, thou dreadful minister of hell!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Thou hadst but power over his mortal body,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: His soul thou canst not have; therefore be gone.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Sweet saint, for charity, be not so curst.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Foul devil, for God's sake, hence, and trouble us not;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: For thou hast made the happy earth thy hell,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Fill'd it with cursing cries and deep exclaims.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: If thou delight to view thy heinous deeds,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Behold this pattern of thy butcheries.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: O, gentlemen, see, see! dead Henry's wounds
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Open their congeal'd mouths and bleed afresh!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Blush, Blush, thou lump of foul deformity;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: For 'tis thy presence that exhales this blood
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: From cold and empty veins, where no blood dwells;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Thy deed, inhuman and unnatural,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Provokes this deluge most unnatural.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: O God, which this blood madest, revenge his death!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: O earth, which this blood drink'st revenge his death!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Either heaven with lightning strike the
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: murderer dead,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Or earth, gape open wide and eat him quick,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: As thou dost swallow up this good king's blood
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Which his hell-govern'd arm hath butchered!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Lady, you know no rules of charity,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Which renders good for bad, blessings for curses.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Villain, thou know'st no law of God nor man:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: No beast so fierce but knows some touch of pity.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: But I know none, and therefore am no beast.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: O wonderful, when devils tell the truth!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: More wonderful, when angels are so angry.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Vouchsafe, divine perfection of a woman,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Of these supposed-evils, to give me leave,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: By circumstance, but to acquit myself.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Vouchsafe, defused infection of a man,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: For these known evils, but to give me leave,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: By circumstance, to curse thy cursed self.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Fairer than tongue can name thee, let me have
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Some patient leisure to excuse myself.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Fouler than heart can think thee, thou canst make
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: No excuse current, but to hang thyself.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: By such despair, I should accuse myself.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: And, by despairing, shouldst thou stand excused;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: For doing worthy vengeance on thyself,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Which didst unworthy slaughter upon others.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Say that I slew them not?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Why, then they are not dead:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: But dead they are, and devilish slave, by thee.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: I did not kill your husband.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Why, then he is alive.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Nay, he is dead; and slain by Edward's hand.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: In thy foul throat thou liest: Queen Margaret saw
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Thy murderous falchion smoking in his blood;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: The which thou once didst bend against her breast,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: But that thy brothers beat aside the point.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: I was provoked by her slanderous tongue,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: which laid their guilt upon my guiltless shoulders.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Thou wast provoked by thy bloody mind.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Which never dreamt on aught but butcheries:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Didst thou not kill this king?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: I grant ye.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Dost grant me, hedgehog? then, God grant me too
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Thou mayst be damned for that wicked deed!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: O, he was gentle, mild, and virtuous!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: The fitter for the King of heaven, that hath him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: He is in heaven, where thou shalt never come.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Let him thank me, that holp to send him thither;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: For he was fitter for that place than earth.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: And thou unfit for any place but hell.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Yes, one place else, if you will hear me name it.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Some dungeon.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Your bed-chamber.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: I'll rest betide the chamber where thou liest!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: So will it, madam till I lie with you.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: I hope so.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: I know so. But, gentle Lady Anne,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: To leave this keen encounter of our wits,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: And fall somewhat into a slower method,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Is not the causer of the timeless deaths
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Of these Plantagenets, Henry and Edward,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: As blameful as the executioner?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Thou art the cause, and most accursed effect.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Your beauty was the cause of that effect;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Your beauty: which did haunt me in my sleep
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: To undertake the death of all the world,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: So I might live one hour in your sweet bosom.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: If I thought that, I tell thee, homicide,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: These nails should rend that beauty from my cheeks.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: These eyes could never endure sweet beauty's wreck;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: You should not blemish it, if I stood by:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: As all the world is cheered by the sun,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: So I by that; it is my day, my life.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Black night o'ershade thy day, and death thy life!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Curse not thyself, fair creature thou art both.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: I would I were, to be revenged on thee.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: It is a quarrel most unnatural,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: To be revenged on him that loveth you.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: It is a quarrel just and reasonable,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: To be revenged on him that slew my husband.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: He that bereft thee, lady, of thy husband,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Did it to help thee to a better husband.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: His better doth not breathe upon the earth.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: He lives that loves thee better than he could.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Name him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Plantagenet.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Why, that was he.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: The selfsame name, but one of better nature.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Where is he?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Here.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Why dost thou spit at me?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Would it were mortal poison, for thy sake!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Never came poison from so sweet a place.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Never hung poison on a fouler toad.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Out of my sight! thou dost infect my eyes.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Thine eyes, sweet lady, have infected mine.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Would they were basilisks, to strike thee dead!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: I would they were, that I might die at once;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: For now they kill me with a living death.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Those eyes of thine from mine have drawn salt tears,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Shamed their aspect with store of childish drops:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: These eyes that never shed remorseful tear,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: No, when my father York and Edward wept,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: To hear the piteous moan that Rutland made
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: When black-faced Clifford shook his sword at him;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Nor when thy warlike father, like a child,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Told the sad story of my father's death,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: And twenty times made pause to sob and weep,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: That all the standers-by had wet their cheeks
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Like trees bedash'd with rain: in that sad time
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: My manly eyes did scorn an humble tear;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: And what these sorrows could not thence exhale,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Thy beauty hath, and made them blind with weeping.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: I never sued to friend nor enemy;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: My tongue could never learn sweet smoothing word;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: But now thy beauty is proposed my fee,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: My proud heart sues, and prompts my tongue to speak.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Teach not thy lips such scorn, for they were made
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: For kissing, lady, not for such contempt.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: If thy revengeful heart cannot forgive,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Lo, here I lend thee this sharp-pointed sword;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Which if thou please to hide in this true bosom.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: And let the soul forth that adoreth thee,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: I lay it naked to the deadly stroke,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: And humbly beg the death upon my knee.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Nay, do not pause; for I did kill King Henry,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: But 'twas thy beauty that provoked me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Nay, now dispatch; 'twas I that stabb'd young Edward,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: But 'twas thy heavenly face that set me on.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Take up the sword again, or take up me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Arise, dissembler: though I wish thy death,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: I will not be the executioner.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Then bid me kill myself, and I will do it.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: I have already.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Tush, that was in thy rage:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Speak it again, and, even with the word,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: That hand, which, for thy love, did kill thy love,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Shall, for thy love, kill a far truer love;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: To both their deaths thou shalt be accessary.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: I would I knew thy heart.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: 'Tis figured in my tongue.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: I fear me both are false.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Then never man was true.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Well, well, put up your sword.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Say, then, my peace is made.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: That shall you know hereafter.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: But shall I live in hope?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: All men, I hope, live so.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Vouchsafe to wear this ring.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: To take is not to give.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Look, how this ring encompasseth finger.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Even so thy breast encloseth my poor heart;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Wear both of them, for both of them are thine.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: And if thy poor devoted suppliant may
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: But beg one favour at thy gracious hand,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Thou dost confirm his happiness for ever.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: What is it?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: That it would please thee leave these sad designs
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: To him that hath more cause to be a mourner,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: And presently repair to Crosby Place;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Where, after I have solemnly interr'd
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: At Chertsey monastery this noble king,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: And wet his grave with my repentant tears,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: I will with all expedient duty see you:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: For divers unknown reasons. I beseech you,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Grant me this boon.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: With all my heart; and much it joys me too,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: To see you are become so penitent.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Tressel and Berkeley, go along with me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Bid me farewell.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: 'Tis more than you deserve;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: But since you teach me how to flatter you,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Imagine I have said farewell already.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Sirs, take up the corse.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Towards Chertsey, noble lord?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: No, to White-Friars; there attend my coining.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Was ever woman in this humour woo'd?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Was ever woman in this humour won?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: I'll have her; but I will not keep her long.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: What! I, that kill'd her husband and his father,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: To take her in her heart's extremest hate,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: With curses in her mouth, tears in her eyes,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: The bleeding witness of her hatred by;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Having God, her conscience, and these bars
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: against me,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: And I nothing to back my suit at all,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: But the plain devil and dissembling looks,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: And yet to win her, all the world to nothing!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Ha!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Hath she forgot already that brave prince,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Edward, her lord, whom I, some three months since,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Stabb'd in my angry mood at Tewksbury?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: A sweeter and a lovelier gentleman,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Framed in the prodigality of nature,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Young, valiant, wise, and, no doubt, right royal,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: The spacious world cannot again afford
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: And will she yet debase her eyes on me,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: That cropp'd the golden prime of this sweet prince,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: And made her widow to a woful bed?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: On me, whose all not equals Edward's moiety?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: On me, that halt and am unshapen thus?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: My dukedom to a beggarly denier,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: I do mistake my person all this while:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Upon my life, she finds, although I cannot,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Myself to be a marvellous proper man.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: I'll be at charges for a looking-glass,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: And entertain some score or two of tailors,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: To study fashions to adorn my body:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Since I am crept in favour with myself,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Will maintain it with some little cost.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: But first I'll turn yon fellow in his grave;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: And then return lamenting to my love.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Shine out, fair sun, till I have bought a glass,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: That I may see my shadow as I pass.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  The same. Another street.

line_text: Have patience, madam: there's no doubt his majesty
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Will soon recover his accustom'd health.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: In that you brook it in, it makes him worse:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Therefore, for God's sake, entertain good comfort,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And cheer his grace with quick and merry words.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: If he were dead, what would betide of me?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: No other harm but loss of such a lord.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The loss of such a lord includes all harm.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The heavens have bless'd you with a goodly son,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To be your comforter when he is gone.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Oh, he is young and his minority
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Is put unto the trust of Richard Gloucester,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A man that loves not me, nor none of you.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Is it concluded that he shall be protector?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: It is determined, not concluded yet:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: But so it must be, if the king miscarry.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Here come the lords of Buckingham and Derby.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Good time of day unto your royal grace!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: God make your majesty joyful as you have been!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The Countess Richmond, good my Lord of Derby.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To your good prayers will scarcely say amen.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Yet, Derby, notwithstanding she's your wife,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And loves not me, be you, good lord, assured
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I hate not you for her proud arrogance.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I do beseech you, either not believe
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The envious slanders of her false accusers;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Or, if she be accused in true report,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Bear with her weakness, which, I think proceeds
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: From wayward sickness, and no grounded malice.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Saw you the king to-day, my Lord of Derby?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: But now the Duke of Buckingham and I
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Are come from visiting his majesty.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What likelihood of his amendment, lords?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Madam, good hope; his grace speaks cheerfully.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: God grant him health! Did you confer with him?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Madam, we did: he desires to make atonement
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Betwixt the Duke of Gloucester and your brothers,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And betwixt them and my lord chamberlain;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And sent to warn them to his royal presence.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Would all were well! but that will never be
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I fear our happiness is at the highest.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: They do me wrong, and I will not endure it:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Who are they that complain unto the king,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That I, forsooth, am stern, and love them not?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: By holy Paul, they love his grace but lightly
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That fill his ears with such dissentious rumours.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Because I cannot flatter and speak fair,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Smile in men's faces, smooth, deceive and cog,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Duck with French nods and apish courtesy,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I must be held a rancorous enemy.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Cannot a plain man live and think no harm,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: But thus his simple truth must be abused
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: By silken, sly, insinuating Jacks?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To whom in all this presence speaks your grace?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To thee, that hast nor honesty nor grace.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: When have I injured thee? when done thee wrong?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Or thee? or thee? or any of your faction?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A plague upon you all! His royal person,--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Whom God preserve better than you would wish!--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Cannot be quiet scarce a breathing-while,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: But you must trouble him with lewd complaints.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Brother of Gloucester, you mistake the matter.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The king, of his own royal disposition,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And not provoked by any suitor else;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Aiming, belike, at your interior hatred,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Which in your outward actions shows itself
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Against my kindred, brothers, and myself,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Makes him to send; that thereby he may gather
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The ground of your ill-will, and so remove it.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I cannot tell: the world is grown so bad,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That wrens make prey where eagles dare not perch:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Since every Jack became a gentleman
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: There's many a gentle person made a Jack.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Come, come, we know your meaning, brother
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Gloucester;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: You envy my advancement and my friends':
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: God grant we never may have need of you!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Meantime, God grants that we have need of you:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Your brother is imprison'd by your means,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Myself disgraced, and the nobility
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Held in contempt; whilst many fair promotions
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Are daily given to ennoble those
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That scarce, some two days since, were worth a noble.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: By Him that raised me to this careful height
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: From that contented hap which I enjoy'd,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I never did incense his majesty
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Against the Duke of Clarence, but have been
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: An earnest advocate to plead for him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: My lord, you do me shameful injury,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Falsely to draw me in these vile suspects.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: You may deny that you were not the cause
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Of my Lord Hastings' late imprisonment.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: She may, my lord, for--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: She may, Lord Rivers! why, who knows not so?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: She may do more, sir, than denying that:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: She may help you to many fair preferments,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And then deny her aiding hand therein,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And lay those honours on your high deserts.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What may she not? She may, yea, marry, may she--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What, marry, may she?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What, marry, may she! marry with a king,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A bachelor, a handsome stripling too:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I wis your grandam had a worser match.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: My Lord of Gloucester, I have too long borne
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Your blunt upbraidings and your bitter scoffs:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: By heaven, I will acquaint his majesty
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: With those gross taunts I often have endured.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I had rather be a country servant-maid
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Than a great queen, with this condition,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To be thus taunted, scorn'd, and baited at:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Small joy have I in being England's queen.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And lessen'd be that small, God, I beseech thee!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Thy honour, state and seat is due to me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What! threat you me with telling of the king?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Tell him, and spare not: look, what I have said
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I will avouch in presence of the king:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I dare adventure to be sent to the Tower.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: 'Tis time to speak; my pains are quite forgot.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Out, devil! I remember them too well:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Thou slewest my husband Henry in the Tower,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And Edward, my poor son, at Tewksbury.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Ere you were queen, yea, or your husband king,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I was a pack-horse in his great affairs;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A weeder-out of his proud adversaries,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A liberal rewarder of his friends:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To royalize his blood I spilt mine own.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Yea, and much better blood than his or thine.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: In all which time you and your husband Grey
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Were factious for the house of Lancaster;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And, Rivers, so were you. Was not your husband
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: In Margaret's battle at Saint Alban's slain?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Let me put in your minds, if you forget,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What you have been ere now, and what you are;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Withal, what I have been, and what I am.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A murderous villain, and so still thou art.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Poor Clarence did forsake his father, Warwick;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Yea, and forswore himself,--which Jesu pardon!--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Which God revenge!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To fight on Edward's party for the crown;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And for his meed, poor lord, he is mew'd up.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I would to God my heart were flint, like Edward's;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Or Edward's soft and pitiful, like mine
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I am too childish-foolish for this world.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Hie thee to hell for shame, and leave the world,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Thou cacodemon! there thy kingdom is.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: My Lord of Gloucester, in those busy days
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Which here you urge to prove us enemies,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: We follow'd then our lord, our lawful king:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: So should we you, if you should be our king.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: If I should be! I had rather be a pedlar:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Far be it from my heart, the thought of it!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: As little joy, my lord, as you suppose
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: You should enjoy, were you this country's king,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: As little joy may you suppose in me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That I enjoy, being the queen thereof.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A little joy enjoys the queen thereof;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: For I am she, and altogether joyless.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I can no longer hold me patient.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Hear me, you wrangling pirates, that fall out
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: In sharing that which you have pill'd from me!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Which of you trembles not that looks on me?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: If not, that, I being queen, you bow like subjects,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Yet that, by you deposed, you quake like rebels?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: O gentle villain, do not turn away!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Foul wrinkled witch, what makest thou in my sight?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: But repetition of what thou hast marr'd;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That will I make before I let thee go.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Wert thou not banished on pain of death?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I was; but I do find more pain in banishment
