line_text: That stabb'd me in the field by Tewksbury;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Seize on him, Furies, take him to your torments!'
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: With that, methoughts, a legion of foul fiends
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Environ'd me about, and howled in mine ears
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Such hideous cries, that with the very noise
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I trembling waked, and for a season after
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Could not believe but that I was in hell,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Such terrible impression made the dream.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: No marvel, my lord, though it affrighted you;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I promise, I am afraid to hear you tell it.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: O Brakenbury, I have done those things,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Which now bear evidence against my soul,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: For Edward's sake; and see how he requites me!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: O God! if my deep prayers cannot appease thee,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: But thou wilt be avenged on my misdeeds,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Yet execute thy wrath in me alone,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: O, spare my guiltless wife and my poor children!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I pray thee, gentle keeper, stay by me;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: My soul is heavy, and I fain would sleep.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I will, my lord: God give your grace good rest!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Sorrow breaks seasons and reposing hours,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Makes the night morning, and the noon-tide night.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Princes have but their tides for their glories,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: An outward honour for an inward toil;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And, for unfelt imagination,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: They often feel a world of restless cares:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: So that, betwixt their tides and low names,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: There's nothing differs but the outward fame.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Ho! who's here?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: In God's name what are you, and how came you hither?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I would speak with Clarence, and I came hither on my legs.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Yea, are you so brief?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: O sir, it is better to be brief than tedious. Show
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: him our commission; talk no more.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I am, in this, commanded to deliver
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The noble Duke of Clarence to your hands:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I will not reason what is meant hereby,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Because I will be guiltless of the meaning.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Here are the keys, there sits the duke asleep:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I'll to the king; and signify to him
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That thus I have resign'd my charge to you.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Do so, it is a point of wisdom: fare you well.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What, shall we stab him as he sleeps?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: No; then he will say 'twas done cowardly, when he wakes.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: When he wakes! why, fool, he shall never wake till
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: the judgment-day.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Why, then he will say we stabbed him sleeping.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The urging of that word 'judgment' hath bred a kind
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: of remorse in me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What, art thou afraid?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Not to kill him, having a warrant for it; but to be
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: damned for killing him, from which no warrant can defend us.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I thought thou hadst been resolute.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: So I am, to let him live.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Back to the Duke of Gloucester, tell him so.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I pray thee, stay a while: I hope my holy humour
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: will change; 'twas wont to hold me but while one
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: would tell twenty.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: How dost thou feel thyself now?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: 'Faith, some certain dregs of conscience are yet
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: within me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Remember our reward, when the deed is done.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: 'Zounds, he dies: I had forgot the reward.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Where is thy conscience now?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: In the Duke of Gloucester's purse.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: So when he opens his purse to give us our reward,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: thy conscience flies out.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Let it go; there's few or none will entertain it.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: How if it come to thee again?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I'll not meddle with it: it is a dangerous thing: it
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: makes a man a coward: a man cannot steal, but it
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: accuseth him; he cannot swear, but it cheques him;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: he cannot lie with his neighbour's wife, but it
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: detects him: 'tis a blushing shamefast spirit that
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: mutinies in a man's bosom; it fills one full of
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: obstacles: it made me once restore a purse of gold
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: that I found; it beggars any man that keeps it: it
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: is turned out of all towns and cities for a
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: dangerous thing; and every man that means to live
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: well endeavours to trust to himself and to live
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: without it.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: 'Zounds, it is even now at my elbow, persuading me
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: not to kill the duke.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Take the devil in thy mind, and relieve him not: he
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: would insinuate with thee but to make thee sigh.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Tut, I am strong-framed, he cannot prevail with me,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I warrant thee.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Spoke like a tail fellow that respects his
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: reputation. Come, shall we to this gear?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Take him over the costard with the hilts of thy
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: sword, and then we will chop him in the malmsey-butt
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: in the next room.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: O excellent devise! make a sop of him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Hark! he stirs: shall I strike?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: No, first let's reason with him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Where art thou, keeper? give me a cup of wine.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: You shall have wine enough, my lord, anon.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: In God's name, what art thou?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A man, as you are.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: But not, as I am, royal.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Nor you, as we are, loyal.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Thy voice is thunder, but thy looks are humble.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: My voice is now the king's, my looks mine own.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: How darkly and how deadly dost thou speak!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Your eyes do menace me: why look you pale?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Who sent you hither? Wherefore do you come?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To, to, to--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To murder me?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Ay, ay.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: You scarcely have the hearts to tell me so,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And therefore cannot have the hearts to do it.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Wherein, my friends, have I offended you?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Offended us you have not, but the king.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I shall be reconciled to him again.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Never, my lord; therefore prepare to die.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Are you call'd forth from out a world of men
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To slay the innocent? What is my offence?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Where are the evidence that do accuse me?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What lawful quest have given their verdict up
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Unto the frowning judge? or who pronounced
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The bitter sentence of poor Clarence' death?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Before I be convict by course of law,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To threaten me with death is most unlawful.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I charge you, as you hope to have redemption
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: By Christ's dear blood shed for our grievous sins,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That you depart and lay no hands on me
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The deed you undertake is damnable.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What we will do, we do upon command.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And he that hath commanded is the king.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Erroneous vassal! the great King of kings
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Hath in the tables of his law commanded
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That thou shalt do no murder: and wilt thou, then,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Spurn at his edict and fulfil a man's?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Take heed; for he holds vengeance in his hands,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To hurl upon their heads that break his law.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And that same vengeance doth he hurl on thee,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: For false forswearing and for murder too:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Thou didst receive the holy sacrament,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To fight in quarrel of the house of Lancaster.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And, like a traitor to the name of God,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Didst break that vow; and with thy treacherous blade
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Unrip'dst the bowels of thy sovereign's son.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Whom thou wert sworn to cherish and defend.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: How canst thou urge God's dreadful law to us,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: When thou hast broke it in so dear degree?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Alas! for whose sake did I that ill deed?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: For Edward, for my brother, for his sake: Why, sirs,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: He sends ye not to murder me for this
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: For in this sin he is as deep as I.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: If God will be revenged for this deed.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: O, know you yet, he doth it publicly,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Take not the quarrel from his powerful arm;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: He needs no indirect nor lawless course
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To cut off those that have offended him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Who made thee, then, a bloody minister,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: When gallant-springing brave Plantagenet,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That princely novice, was struck dead by thee?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: My brother's love, the devil, and my rage.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Thy brother's love, our duty, and thy fault,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Provoke us hither now to slaughter thee.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Oh, if you love my brother, hate not me;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I am his brother, and I love him well.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: If you be hired for meed, go back again,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And I will send you to my brother Gloucester,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Who shall reward you better for my life
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Than Edward will for tidings of my death.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: You are deceived, your brother Gloucester hates you.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: O, no, he loves me, and he holds me dear:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Go you to him from me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Ay, so we will.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Tell him, when that our princely father York
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Bless'd his three sons with his victorious arm,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And charged us from his soul to love each other,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: He little thought of this divided friendship:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Bid Gloucester think of this, and he will weep.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Ay, millstones; as be lesson'd us to weep.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: O, do not slander him, for he is kind.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Right,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: As snow in harvest. Thou deceivest thyself:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: 'Tis he that sent us hither now to slaughter thee.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: It cannot be; for when I parted with him,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: He hugg'd me in his arms, and swore, with sobs,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That he would labour my delivery.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Why, so he doth, now he delivers thee
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: From this world's thraldom to the joys of heaven.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Make peace with God, for you must die, my lord.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Hast thou that holy feeling in thy soul,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To counsel me to make my peace with God,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And art thou yet to thy own soul so blind,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That thou wilt war with God by murdering me?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Ah, sirs, consider, he that set you on
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To do this deed will hate you for the deed.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What shall we do?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Relent, and save your souls.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Relent! 'tis cowardly and womanish.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Not to relent is beastly, savage, devilish.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Which of you, if you were a prince's son,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Being pent from liberty, as I am now,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: if two such murderers as yourselves came to you,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Would not entreat for life?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: My friend, I spy some pity in thy looks:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: O, if thine eye be not a flatterer,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Come thou on my side, and entreat for me,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: As you would beg, were you in my distress
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A begging prince what beggar pities not?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Look behind you, my lord.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Take that, and that: if all this will not do,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I'll drown you in the malmsey-butt within.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A bloody deed, and desperately dispatch'd!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: How fain, like Pilate, would I wash my hands
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Of this most grievous guilty murder done!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: How now! what mean'st thou, that thou help'st me not?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: By heavens, the duke shall know how slack thou art!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I would he knew that I had saved his brother!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Take thou the fee, and tell him what I say;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: For I repent me that the duke is slain.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: So do not I: go, coward as thou art.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Now must I hide his body in some hole,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Until the duke take order for his burial:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And when I have my meed, I must away;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: For this will out, and here I must not stay.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Why, so: now have I done a good day's work:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: You peers, continue this united league:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I every day expect an embassage
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: From my Redeemer to redeem me hence;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And now in peace my soul shall part to heaven,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Since I have set my friends at peace on earth.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Rivers and Hastings, take each other's hand;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Dissemble not your hatred, swear your love.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: By heaven, my heart is purged from grudging hate:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And with my hand I seal my true heart's love.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: So thrive I, as I truly swear the like!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Take heed you dally not before your king;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Lest he that is the supreme King of kings
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Confound your hidden falsehood, and award
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Either of you to be the other's end.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: So prosper I, as I swear perfect love!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And I, as I love Hastings with my heart!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Madam, yourself are not exempt in this,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Nor your son Dorset, Buckingham, nor you;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: You have been factious one against the other,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Wife, love Lord Hastings, let him kiss your hand;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And what you do, do it unfeignedly.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Here, Hastings; I will never more remember
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Our former hatred, so thrive I and mine!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Dorset, embrace him; Hastings, love lord marquess.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: This interchange of love, I here protest,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Upon my part shall be unviolable.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And so swear I, my lord

line_text: O, my fair cousin, I must not say so.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Then is he more beholding to you than I.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: He may command me as my sovereign;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: But you have power in me as in a kinsman.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I pray you, uncle, give me this dagger.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: My dagger, little cousin? with all my heart.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A beggar, brother?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Of my kind uncle, that I know will give;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And being but a toy, which is no grief to give.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A greater gift than that I'll give my cousin.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A greater gift! O, that's the sword to it.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A gentle cousin, were it light enough.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: O, then, I see, you will part but with light gifts;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: In weightier things you'll say a beggar nay.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: It is too heavy for your grace to wear.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I weigh it lightly, were it heavier.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What, would you have my weapon, little lord?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I would, that I might thank you as you call me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: How?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Little.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: My Lord of York will still be cross in talk:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Uncle, your grace knows how to bear with him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: You mean, to bear me, not to bear with me:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Uncle, my brother mocks both you and me;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Because that I am little, like an ape,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: He thinks that you should bear me on your shoulders.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: With what a sharp-provided wit he reasons!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To mitigate the scorn he gives his uncle,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: He prettily and aptly taunts himself:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: So cunning and so young is wonderful.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: My lord, will't please you pass along?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Myself and my good cousin Buckingham
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Will to your mother, to entreat of her
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To meet you at the Tower and welcome you.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What, will you go unto the Tower, my lord?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: My lord protector needs will have it so.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I shall not sleep in quiet at the Tower.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Why, what should you fear?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Marry, my uncle Clarence' angry ghost:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: My grandam told me he was murdered there.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I fear no uncles dead.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Nor none that live, I hope.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: An if they live, I hope I need not fear.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: But come, my lord; and with a heavy heart,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Thinking on them, go I unto the Tower.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Think you, my lord, this little prating York
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Was not incensed by his subtle mother
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To taunt and scorn you thus opprobriously?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: No doubt, no doubt; O, 'tis a parlous boy;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Bold, quick, ingenious, forward, capable
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: He is all the mother's, from the top to toe.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Well, let them rest. Come hither, Catesby.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Thou art sworn as deeply to effect what we intend
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: As closely to conceal what we impart:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Thou know'st our reasons urged upon the way;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What think'st thou? is it not an easy matter
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To make William Lord Hastings of our mind,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: For the instalment of this noble duke
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: In the seat royal of this famous isle?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: He for his father's sake so loves the prince,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That he will not be won to aught against him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What think'st thou, then, of Stanley? what will he?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: He will do all in all as Hastings doth.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Well, then, no more but this: go, gentle Catesby,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And, as it were far off sound thou Lord Hastings,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: How doth he stand affected to our purpose;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And summon him to-morrow to the Tower,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To sit about the coronation.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: If thou dost find him tractable to us,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Encourage him, and show him all our reasons:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: If he be leaden, icy-cold, unwilling,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Be thou so too; and so break off your talk,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And give us notice of his inclination:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: For we to-morrow hold divided councils,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Wherein thyself shalt highly be employ'd.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Commend me to Lord William: tell him, Catesby,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: His ancient knot of dangerous adversaries
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To-morrow are let blood at Pomfret-castle;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And bid my friend, for joy of this good news,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Give mistress Shore one gentle kiss the more.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Good Catesby, go, effect this business soundly.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: My good lords both, with all the heed I may.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Shall we hear from you, Catesby, ere we sleep?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: You shall, my lord.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: At Crosby Place, there shall you find us both.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Now, my lord, what shall we do, if we perceive
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Lord Hastings will not yield to our complots?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Chop off his head, man; somewhat we will do:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And, look, when I am king, claim thou of me
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The earldom of Hereford, and the moveables
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Whereof the king my brother stood possess'd.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I'll claim that promise at your grace's hands.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And look to have it yielded with all willingness.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Come, let us sup betimes, that afterwards
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: We may digest our complots in some form.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What, ho! my lord!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: A messenger from the Lord Stanley.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: What is't o'clock?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Upon the stroke of four.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Cannot thy master sleep these tedious nights?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: So it should seem by that I have to say.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: First, he commends him to your noble lordship.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: And then?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: And then he sends you word
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: He dreamt to-night the boar had razed his helm:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Besides, he says there are two councils held;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: And that may be determined at the one
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: which may make you and him to rue at the other.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Therefore he sends to know your lordship's pleasure,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: If presently you will take horse with him,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: And with all speed post with him toward the north,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: To shun the danger that his soul divines.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Go, fellow, go, return unto thy lord;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Bid him not fear the separated councils
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: His honour and myself are at the one,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: And at the other is my servant Catesby
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Where nothing can proceed that toucheth us
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Whereof I shall not have intelligence.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Tell him his fears are shallow, wanting instance:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: And for his dreams, I wonder he is so fond
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: To trust the mockery of unquiet slumbers
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: To fly the boar before the boar pursues,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Were to incense the boar to follow us
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: And make pursuit where he did mean no chase.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Go, bid thy master rise and come to me
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: And we will both together to the Tower,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Where, he shall see, the boar will use us kindly.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: My gracious lord, I'll tell him what you say.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Many good morrows to my noble lord!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Good morrow, Catesby; you are early stirring
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: What news, what news, in this our tottering state?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: It is a reeling world, indeed, my lord;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: And I believe twill never stand upright
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Tim Richard wear the garland of the realm.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: How! wear the garland! dost thou mean the crown?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Ay, my good lord.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: I'll have this crown of mine cut from my shoulders
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Ere I will see the crown so foul misplaced.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: But canst thou guess that he doth aim at it?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Ay, on my life; and hopes to find forward
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Upon his party for the gain thereof:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: And thereupon he sends you this good news,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: That this same very day your enemies,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: The kindred of the queen, must die at Pomfret.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Indeed, I am no mourner for that news,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Because they have been still mine enemies:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: But, that I'll give my voice on Richard's side,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: To bar my master's heirs in true descent,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: God knows I will not do it, to the death.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: God keep your lordship in that gracious mind!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: But I shall laugh at this a twelve-month hence,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: That they who brought me in my master's hate
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: I live to look upon their tragedy.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: I tell thee, Catesby--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: What, my lord?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Ere a fortnight make me elder,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: I'll send some packing that yet think not on it.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: 'Tis a vile thing to die, my gracious lord,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: When men are unprepared and look not for it.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: O monstrous, monstrous! and so falls it out
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: With Rivers, Vaughan, Grey: and so 'twill do
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: With some men else, who think themselves as safe
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: As thou and I; who, as thou know'st, are dear
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: To princely Richard and to Buckingham.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: The princes both make high account of you;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: For they account his head upon the bridge.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: I know they do; and I have well deserved it.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Come on, come on; where is your boar-spear, man?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Fear you the boar, and go so unprovided?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: My lord, good morrow; good morrow, Catesby:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: You may jest on, but, by the holy rood,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: I do not like these several councils, I.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: My lord,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: I hold my life as dear as you do yours;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: And never in my life, I do protest,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Was it more precious to me than 'tis now:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Think you, but that I know our state secure,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: I would be so triumphant as I am?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: The lords at Pomfret, when they rode from London,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Were jocund, and supposed their state was sure,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: And they indeed had no cause to mistrust;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: But yet, you see how soon the day o'ercast.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: This sudden stag of rancour I misdoubt:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Pray God, I say, I prove a needless coward!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: What, shall we toward the Tower? the day is spent.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Come, come, have with you. Wot you what, my lord?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: To-day the lords you talk of are beheaded.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: They, for their truth, might better wear their heads
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Than some that have accused them wear their hats.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: But come, my lord, let us away.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Go on before; I'll talk with this good fellow.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: How now, sirrah! how goes the world with thee?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: The better that your lordship please to ask.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: I tell thee, man, 'tis better with me now
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Than when I met thee last where now we meet:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Then was I going prisoner to the Tower,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: By the suggestion of the queen's allies;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: But now, I tell thee--keep it to thyself--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: This day those enemies are put to death,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: And I in better state than e'er I was.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: God hold it, to your honour's good content!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Gramercy, fellow: there, drink that for me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: God save your lordship!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Well met, my lord; I am glad to see your honour.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: I thank thee, good Sir John, with all my heart.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: I am in your debt for your last exercise;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Come the next Sabbath, and I will content you.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: What, talking with a priest, lord chamberlain?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Your friends at Pomfret, they do need the priest;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Your honour hath no shriving work in hand.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Good faith, and when I met this holy man,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Those men you talk of came into my mind.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: What, go you toward the Tower?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: I do, my lord; but long I shall not stay
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: I shall return before your lordship thence.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: 'Tis like enough, for I stay dinner there.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Come, will you go?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: I'll wait upon your lordship.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.

line_text: Come, bring forth the prisoners.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Sir Richard Ratcliff, let me tell thee this:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To-day shalt thou behold a subject die
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: For truth, for duty, and for loyalty.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: God keep the prince from all the pack of you!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A knot you are of damned blood-suckers!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: You live that shall cry woe for this after.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Dispatch; the limit of your lives is out.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: O Pomfret, Pomfret! O thou bloody prison,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Fatal and ominous to noble peers!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Within the guilty closure of thy walls
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Richard the second here was hack'd to death;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And, for more slander to thy dismal seat,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: We give thee up our guiltless blood to drink.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Now Margaret's curse is fall'n upon our heads,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: For standing by when Richard stabb'd her son.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Then cursed she Hastings, then cursed she Buckingham,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Then cursed she Richard. O, remember, God
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To hear her prayers for them, as now for us
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And for my sister and her princely sons,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Be satisfied, dear God, with our true blood,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Which, as thou know'st, unjustly must be spilt.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Make haste; the hour of death is expiate.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Come, Grey, come, Vaughan, let us all embrace:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And take our leave, until we meet in heaven.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: My lords, at once: the cause why we are met
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Is, to determine of the coronation.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: In God's name, speak: when is the royal day?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Are all things fitting for that royal time?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: It is, and wants but nomination.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: To-morrow, then, I judge a happy day.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Who knows the lord protector's mind herein?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Who is most inward with the royal duke?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Your grace, we think, should soonest know his mind.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Who, I, my lord I we know each other's faces,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: But for our hearts, he knows no more of mine,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Than I of yours;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Nor I no more of his, than you of mine.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Lord Hastings, you and he are near in love.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: I thank his grace, I know he loves me well;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: But, for his purpose in the coronation.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: I have not sounded him, nor he deliver'd
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: His gracious pleasure any way therein:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: But you, my noble lords, may name the time;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: And in the duke's behalf I'll give my voice,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Which, I presume, he'll take in gentle part.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Now in good time, here comes the duke himself.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: My noble lords and cousins all, good morrow.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: I have been long a sleeper; but, I hope,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: My absence doth neglect no great designs,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Which by my presence might have been concluded.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Had not you come upon your cue, my lord
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: William Lord Hastings had pronounced your part,--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: I mean, your voice,--for crowning of the king.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Than my Lord Hastings no man might be bolder;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: His lordship knows me well, and loves me well.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: I thank your grace.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: My lord of Ely!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: My lord?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: When I was last in Holborn,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: I saw good strawberries in your garden there
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: I do beseech you send for some of them.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Marry, and will, my lord, with all my heart.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Cousin of Buckingham, a word with you.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Catesby hath sounded Hastings in our business,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: And finds the testy gentleman so hot,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: As he will lose his head ere give consent
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: His master's son, as worshipful as he terms it,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Shall lose the royalty of England's throne.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Withdraw you hence, my lord, I'll follow you.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: We have not yet set down this day of triumph.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: To-morrow, in mine opinion, is too sudden;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: For I myself am not so well provided
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: As else I would be, were the day prolong'd.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Where is my lord protector? I have sent for these
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: strawberries.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: His grace looks cheerfully and smooth to-day;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: There's some conceit or other likes him well,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: When he doth bid good morrow with such a spirit.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: I think there's never a man in Christendom
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: That can less hide his love or hate than he;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: For by his face straight shall you know his heart.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: What of his heart perceive you in his face
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: By any likelihood he show'd to-day?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Marry, that with no man here he is offended;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: For, were he, he had shown it in his looks.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: I pray God he be not, I say.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: I pray you all, tell me what they deserve
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: That do conspire my death with devilish plots
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Of damned witchcraft, and that have prevail'd
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Upon my body with their hellish charms?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: The tender love I bear your grace, my lord,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Makes me most forward in this noble presence
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: To doom the offenders, whatsoever they be
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: I say, my lord, they have deserved death.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Then be your eyes the witness of this ill:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: See how I am bewitch'd; behold mine arm
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Is, like a blasted sapling, wither'd up:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: And this is Edward's wife, that monstrous witch,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Consorted with that harlot strumpet Shore,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: That by their witchcraft thus have marked me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: If they have done this thing, my gracious lord--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: If I thou protector of this damned strumpet--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Tellest thou me of 'ifs'?  Thou art a traitor:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Off with his head! Now, by Saint Paul I swear,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: I will not dine until I see the same.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Lovel and Ratcliff, look that it be done:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: The rest, that love me, rise and follow me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Woe, woe for England! not a whit for me;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: For I, too fond, might have prevented this.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Stanley did dream the boar did raze his helm;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: But I disdain'd it, and did scorn to fly:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Three times to-day my foot-cloth horse did stumble,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: And startled, when he look'd upon the Tower,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: As loath to bear me to the slaughter-house.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: O, now I want the priest that spake to me:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: I now repent I told the pursuivant
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: As 'twere triumphing at mine enemies,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: How they at Pomfret bloodily were butcher'd,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: And I myself secure in grace and favour.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: O Margaret, Margaret, now thy heavy curse
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Is lighted on poor Hastings' wretched head!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Dispatch, my lord; the duke would be at dinner:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Make a short shrift; he longs to see your head.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: O momentary grace of mortal men,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Which we more hunt for than the grace of God!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Who builds his hopes in air of your good looks,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Lives like a drunken sailor on a mast,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Ready, with every nod, to tumble down
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Into the fatal bowels of the deep.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Come, come, dispatch; 'tis bootless to exclaim.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: O bloody Richard! miserable England!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: I prophesy the fearful'st time to thee
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: That ever wretched age hath look'd upon.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Come, lead me to the block; bear him my head.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: They smile at me that shortly shall be dead.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.

line_text: Come, cousin, canst thou quake, and change thy colour,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Murder thy breath in the middle of a word,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And then begin again, and stop again,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: As if thou wert distraught and mad with terror?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Tut, I can counterfeit the deep tragedian;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Speak and look back, and pry on every side,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Tremble and start at wagging of a straw,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Intending deep suspicion: ghastly looks
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Are at my service, like enforced smiles;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And both are ready in their offices,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: At any time, to grace my stratagems.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: But what, is Catesby gone?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: He is; and, see, he brings the mayor along.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Lord mayor,--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Look to the drawbridge there!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Hark! a drum.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Catesby, o'erlook the walls.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Lord mayor, the reason we have sent--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Look back, defend thee, here are enemies.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: God and our innocency defend and guard us!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Be patient, they are friends, Ratcliff and Lovel.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Here is the head of that ignoble traitor,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The dangerous and unsuspected Hastings.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: So dear I loved the man, that I must weep.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I took him for the plainest harmless creature
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That breathed upon this earth a Christian;
