play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: An honest tale speeds best being plainly told.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Then in plain terms tell her my loving tale.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Plain and not honest is too harsh a style.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Your reasons are too shallow and too quick.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: O no, my reasons are too deep and dead;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Too deep and dead, poor infants, in their grave.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Harp not on that string, madam; that is past.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Harp on it still shall I till heart-strings break.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Now, by my George, my garter, and my crown,--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Profaned, dishonour'd, and the third usurp'd.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I swear--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: By nothing; for this is no oath:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The George, profaned, hath lost his holy honour;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The garter, blemish'd, pawn'd his knightly virtue;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The crown, usurp'd, disgraced his kingly glory.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: if something thou wilt swear to be believed,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Swear then by something that thou hast not wrong'd.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Now, by the world--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: 'Tis full of thy foul wrongs.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: My father's death--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Thy life hath that dishonour'd.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Then, by myself--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Thyself thyself misusest.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Why then, by God--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: God's wrong is most of all.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: If thou hadst fear'd to break an oath by Him,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The unity the king thy brother made
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Had not been broken, nor my brother slain:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: If thou hadst fear'd to break an oath by Him,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The imperial metal, circling now thy brow,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Had graced the tender temples of my child,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And both the princes had been breathing here,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Which now, two tender playfellows to dust,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Thy broken faith hath made a prey for worms.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What canst thou swear by now?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The time to come.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That thou hast wronged in the time o'erpast;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: For I myself have many tears to wash
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Hereafter time, for time past wrong'd by thee.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The children live, whose parents thou hast
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: slaughter'd,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Ungovern'd youth, to wail it in their age;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The parents live, whose children thou hast butcher'd,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Old wither'd plants, to wail it with their age.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Swear not by time to come; for that thou hast
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Misused ere used, by time misused o'erpast.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: As I intend to prosper and repent,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: So thrive I in my dangerous attempt
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Of hostile arms! myself myself confound!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Heaven and fortune bar me happy hours!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Day, yield me not thy light; nor, night, thy rest!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Be opposite all planets of good luck
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To my proceedings, if, with pure heart's love,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Immaculate devotion, holy thoughts,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I tender not thy beauteous princely daughter!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: In her consists my happiness and thine;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Without her, follows to this land and me,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To thee, herself, and many a Christian soul,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Death, desolation, ruin and decay:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: It cannot be avoided but by this;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: It will not be avoided but by this.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Therefore, good mother,--I must can you so--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Be the attorney of my love to her:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Plead what I will be, not what I have been;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Not my deserts, but what I will deserve:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Urge the necessity and state of times,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And be not peevish-fond in great designs.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Shall I be tempted of the devil thus?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Ay, if the devil tempt thee to do good.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Shall I forget myself to be myself?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Ay, if yourself's remembrance wrong yourself.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: But thou didst kill my children.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: But in your daughter's womb I bury them:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Where in that nest of spicery they shall breed
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Selves of themselves, to your recomforture.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Shall I go win my daughter to thy will?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And be a happy mother by the deed.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I go. Write to me very shortly.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And you shall understand from me her mind.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Bear her my true love's kiss; and so, farewell.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Relenting fool, and shallow, changing woman!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: How now! what news?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: My gracious sovereign, on the western coast
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Rideth a puissant navy; to the shore
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Throng many doubtful hollow-hearted friends,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Unarm'd, and unresolved to beat them back:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: 'Tis thought that Richmond is their admiral;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And there they hull, expecting but the aid
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Of Buckingham to welcome them ashore.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Here, my lord.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Throng to the bar, crying all, Guilty! guilty!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I shall despair. There is no creature loves me;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And if I die, no soul shall pity me:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Nay, wherefore should they, since that I myself
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Find in myself no pity to myself?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Methought the souls of all that I had murder'd
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Came to my tent; and every one did threat
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To-morrow's vengeance on the head of Richard.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: My lord!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: 'Zounds! who is there?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Ratcliff, my lord; 'tis I. The early village-cock
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Hath twice done salutation to the morn;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Your friends are up, and buckle on their armour.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: O Ratcliff, I have dream'd a fearful dream!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What thinkest thou, will our friends prove all true?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: No doubt, my lord.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: O Ratcliff, I fear, I fear,--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Nay, good my lord, be not afraid of shadows.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: By the apostle Paul, shadows to-night
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Have struck more terror to the soul of Richard
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Than can the substance of ten thousand soldiers
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Armed in proof, and led by shallow Richmond.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: It is not yet near day. Come, go with me;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Under our tents I'll play the eaves-dropper,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To see if any mean to shrink from me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Good morrow, Richmond!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Cry mercy, lords and watchful gentlemen,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That you have ta'en a tardy sluggard here.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: How have you slept, my lord?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The sweetest sleep, and fairest-boding dreams
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That ever enter'd in a drowsy head,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Have I since your departure had, my lords.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Methought their souls, whose bodies Richard murder'd,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Came to my tent, and cried on victory:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I promise you, my soul is very jocund
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: In the remembrance of so fair a dream.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: How far into the morning is it, lords?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Upon the stroke of four.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Why, then 'tis time to arm and give direction.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: More than I have said, loving countrymen,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The leisure and enforcement of the time
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Forbids to dwell upon: yet remember this,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: God and our good cause fight upon our side;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The prayers of holy saints and wronged souls,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Like high-rear'd bulwarks, stand before our faces;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Richard except, those whom we fight against
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Had rather have us win than him they follow:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: For what is he they follow?  truly, gentlemen,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A bloody tyrant and a homicide;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: One raised in blood, and one in blood establish'd;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: One that made means to come by what he hath,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And slaughter'd those that were the means to help him;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Abase foul stone, made precious by the foil
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Of England's chair, where he is falsely set;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: One that hath ever been God's enemy:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Then, if you fight against God's enemy,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: God will in justice ward you as his soldiers;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: If you do sweat to put a tyrant down,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: You sleep in peace, the tyrant being slain;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: If you do fight against your country's foes,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Your country's fat shall pay your pains the hire;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: If you do fight in safeguard of your wives,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Your wives shall welcome home the conquerors;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: If you do free your children from the sword,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Your children's children quit it in your age.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Then, in the name of God and all these rights,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Advance your standards, draw your willing swords.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: For me, the ransom of my bold attempt
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Shall be this cold corpse on the earth's cold face;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: But if I thrive, the gain of my attempt
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The least of you shall share his part thereof.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Sound drums and trumpets boldly and cheerfully;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: God and Saint George! Richmond and victory!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What said Northumberland as touching Richmond?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That he was never trained up in arms.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: He said the truth: and what said Surrey then?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: He smiled and said 'The better for our purpose.'
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: He was in the right; and so indeed it is.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Ten the clock there. Give me a calendar.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Who saw the sun to-day?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Not I, my lord.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Then he disdains to shine; for by the book
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: He should have braved the east an hour ago
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A black day will it be to somebody. Ratcliff!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: My lord?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The sun will not be seen to-day;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: The sky doth frown and lour upon our army.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I would these dewy tears were from the ground.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Not shine to-day! Why, what is that to me
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: More than to Richmond?  for the selfsame heaven
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: That frowns on me looks sadly upon him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Arm, arm, my lord; the foe vaunts in the field.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Come, bustle, bustle; caparison my horse.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Call up Lord Stanley, bid him bring his power:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: I will lead forth my soldiers to the plain,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And thus my battle shall be ordered:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: My foreward shall be drawn out all in length,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Consisting equally of horse and foot;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Our archers shall be placed in the midst
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: John Duke of Norfolk, Thomas Earl of Surrey,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Shall have the leading of this foot and horse.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: They thus directed, we will follow
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: In the main battle, whose puissance on either side
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Shall be well winged with our chiefest horse.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: This, and Saint George to boot! What think'st thou, Norfolk?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A good direction, warlike sovereign.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: This found I on my tent this morning.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: 'Jockey of Norfolk, be not too bold,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: For Dickon thy master is bought and sold.'
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A thing devised by the enemy.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Go, gentleman, every man unto his charge
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Let not our babbling dreams affright our souls:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Conscience is but a word that cowards use,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Devised at first to keep the strong in awe:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Our strong arms be our conscience, swords our law.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: March on, join bravely, let us to't pell-mell
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: If not to heaven, then hand in hand to hell.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What shall I say more than I have inferr'd?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Remember whom you are to cope withal;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A sort of vagabonds, rascals, and runaways,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A scum of Bretons, and base lackey peasants,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Whom their o'er-cloyed country vomits forth
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: To desperate ventures and assured destruction.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: You sleeping safe, they bring to you unrest;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: You having lands, and blest with beauteous wives,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: They would restrain the one, distain the other.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And who doth lead them but a paltry fellow,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Long kept in Bretagne at our mother's cost?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A milk-sop, one that never in his life
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Felt so much cold as over shoes in snow?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Let's whip these stragglers o'er the seas again;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Lash hence these overweening rags of France,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: These famish'd beggars, weary of their lives;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Who, but for dreaming on this fond exploit,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: For want of means, poor rats, had hang'd themselves:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: If we be conquer'd, let men conquer us,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And not these bastard Bretons; whom our fathers
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Have in their own land beaten, bobb'd, and thump'd,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: And in record, left them the heirs of shame.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Shall these enjoy our lands?  lie with our wives?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Ravish our daughters?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Hark! I hear their drum.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Fight, gentlemen of England! fight, bold yoemen!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Draw, archers, draw your arrows to the head!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Spur your proud horses hard, and ride in blood;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Amaze the welkin with your broken staves!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: What says Lord Stanley? will he bring his power?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: My lord, he doth deny to come.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Off with his son George's head!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: My lord, the enemy is past the marsh
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: After the battle let George Stanley die.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: A thousand hearts are great within my bosom:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Advance our standards, set upon our foes
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Our ancient word of courage, fair Saint George,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Inspire us with the spleen of fiery dragons!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Upon them! victory sits on our helms.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

line_text: Rescue, my Lord of Norfolk, rescue, rescue!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The king enacts more wonders than a man,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Daring an opposite to every danger:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: His horse is slain, and all on foot he fights,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Seeking for Richmond in the throat of death.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Rescue, fair lord, or else the day is lost!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: A horse! a horse! my kingdom for a horse!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Withdraw, my lord; I'll help you to a horse.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Slave, I have set my life upon a cast,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And I will stand the hazard of the die:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I think there be six Richmonds in the field;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Five have I slain to-day instead of him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: A horse! a horse! my kingdom for a horse!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: God and your arms be praised, victorious friends,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The day is ours, the bloody dog is dead.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Courageous Richmond, well hast thou acquit thee.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Lo, here, this long-usurped royalty
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: From the dead temples of this bloody wretch
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Have I pluck'd off, to grace thy brows withal:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Wear it, enjoy it, and make much of it.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Great God of heaven, say Amen to all!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: But, tell me, is young George Stanley living?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: He is, my lord, and safe in Leicester town;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Whither, if it please you, we may now withdraw us.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: What men of name are slain on either side?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: John Duke of Norfolk, Walter Lord Ferrers,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Sir Robert Brakenbury, and Sir William Brandon.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Inter their bodies as becomes their births:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Proclaim a pardon to the soldiers fled
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: That in submission will return to us:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And then, as we have ta'en the sacrament,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: We will unite the white rose and the red:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Smile heaven upon this fair conjunction,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: That long have frown'd upon their enmity!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: What traitor hears me, and says not amen?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: England hath long been mad, and scarr'd herself;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The brother blindly shed the brother's blood,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The father rashly slaughter'd his own son,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The son, compell'd, been butcher to the sire:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: All this divided York and Lancaster,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Divided in their dire division,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: O, now, let Richmond and Elizabeth,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The true succeeders of each royal house,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: By God's fair ordinance conjoin together!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And let their heirs, God, if thy will be so.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Enrich the time to come with smooth-faced peace,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: With smiling plenty and fair prosperous days!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Abate the edge of traitors, gracious Lord,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: That would reduce these bloody days again,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And make poor England weep in streams of blood!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Let them not live to taste this land's increase
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: That would with treason wound this fair land's peace!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Now civil wounds are stopp'd, peace lives again:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: That she may long live here, God say amen!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Richard the Third
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
